Geoms.description: Geoms, short for geometric objects, describe the type of plot you will produce.

items.geom_abline: Line, specified by slope and intercept

items.geom_bar: Bars, rectangles with bases on y-axis

items.geom_contour: Display contours of a 3d surface in 2d

items.geom_crossbar: Hollow bar with middle indicated by horizontal line

items.geom_line: Connect observations, in ordered by x value

items.geom_linerange: An interval represented by a vertical line

items.geom_pointrange: An interval represented by a vertical line, with a point in the middle

items.geom_quantile: Add quantile lines from a quantile regression

items.geom_ribbon: Ribbons, y range with continuous x values

items.geom_tile: Tile plot as densely as possible, assuming that every tile is the same size

Statistics.description: It's often useful to transform your data before plotting, and that's what statistical transformations do.

items.stat_abline: Add a line with slope and intercept

items.stat_boxplot: Calculate components of box and whisker plot

items.stat_spoke: Convert angle and radius to xend and yend

items.stat_sum: Sum unique values. Useful for overplotting on scatterplots

items.stat_summary: Summarise y values at every unique x

Scales.description: Scales control the mapping between data and aesthetics.

items.scale_hue: Qualitative colour scale with evenly spaced hues

items.scale_brewer: Sequential, diverging and qualitative colour scales from colorbrewer.org

items.scale_gradient2: Smooth gradient between three colours (high, low and midpoints)

Coordinate systems.description: Coordinate systems adjust the mapping from coordinates to the 2d plane of the computer screen.

Faceting.description: Facets display subsets of the dataset in different panels.

items.facet_grid: Lay out panels in a rectangular/tabular manner.

items.facet_wrap: Wrap a 1d ribbon of panels into 2d.

Position adjustments.description: Position adjustments can be used to fine tune positioning of objects to achieve effects like dodging, jittering and stacking.

items.position_dodge: Adjust position by dodging overlaps to the side

items.position_fill: Stack overlapping objects on top of one another, and standardise have equal height

items.position_stack: Stack overlapping objects on top of one another
